intro: Bonnaya verbenifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf bonnaya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
